column2: Dwarf stone and Dwarf arms guard the heart of the fortress.
Dwarf stone and Dwarf arms guard the heart of the fortress.
A strong bulwark against the outside world provides the first line of Dwarf defences.
Great smelting furnaces and casting molds allow for the production of the legendary Dwarf cannons.
A manufacturing centre attracts artisans and merchants.
Exploratory mine shafts provide small amounts of valuable metal ores and stone.
Quarrelers practice their aim at this small range.
A shrine to the ancestors is a necessity for any Dwarf hold.
The castle is dedicated to resisting attacks with strong walls and a solid garrison.

A small town is allowed to form around the castle, encompassed by curtain walls. The increased population and sprawl makes the castle harder to hold in a siege, but the settlement provides additional tax income and levies.
The castle fortifications are extended around a dedicated shipyard and port.

A small port town is allowed to form around the castle, encompassed by curtain walls. The increased population and sprawl makes the castle harder to hold in a siege, but the settlement provides additional tax income and levies.
The hold is reinforced to resist attack.
Small settlements are encouraged to be built around the main holding.
This castle is populated primarily by humans.

The city of Talabheim is exceptionally well defended thanks to its location inside the Taalbaston walls built atop the crater rim.
The city of Middenheim is exceptionally well defended thanks to its location atop the Fauschlag spire.
Warriors are encouraged to join bloody contests and rituals to prove their bravery and might.
Warriors are encouraged to join bloody contests and rituals to prove their bravery and might.

Large tracts of land are turned over for village charters, with oversight and investment from the upper classes. Small settlements will invariably form, supporting the population used to work the expansive farmlands. Mining, forestry and light industry are also not uncommon depending on the region.

Large tracts of the surrounding land are turned over to the minor nobility. This is invariably used for manors, minor fortifications, hunting grounds and the support of household retainers.
Large tracts of the surrounding land are turned over to the minor nobility. This is invariably used for manors, minor fortifications, hunting grounds and the support of household retainers.

Large tracts of the surrounding land are turned over to the minor nobility. This is invariably used for manors, minor fortifications, hunting grounds and the support of household retainers.
Future warriors gain experience by participating in hunting and scouting. This is only buildable on Steppe terrain.
A great parade and assembly ground is cleared so that riders can be gathered in great numbers and practice maneuvers. This is only buildable on Steppe terrain.
A great communal structure is built to house the soldiers. This is only buildable on Steppe terrain.
All manner of labourers and craftsmen are brought togeher to outfit and supply the growing war host. This is only buildable on Steppe terrain.
Many structures and tents are built to house the great mass of mounted soldiers. This is only buildable on Steppe terrain.
The presence of a herdstone draws beastmen from across the land.
Aspiring warriors are gifted with daemonic weapons and armour.
A professional core of soldiers are trained and quartered for the service of their lord.

The local militia are combined with sellswords and adventurers, creating a cheap yet effective army that can be raised at a moments notice. The high proportion of 'former' bandits, pirates, and criminals seeking gold for blood means the levies are bolstered with some tested skill and courage.

In exchange for generous landed estates and legal privilages, the minor nobility are required to volunteer their swords and lances when called upon. In addition to the typical peasant levy, a significant number of knights and squires form the core of the army, unmatched in training and equipment.

The peasants form the vast bulk of the army. While the majority are simply herded en-masse to the battle with whatever weapons they can find, the best and most trustworthy are provided with some training and equipment. Mounted yeomen are deployed as scouts and skirmishers, while stubborn men-at-arms are sent to anchor the infantry in place.

A small collection of books are kept in the castle for the enjoyment of the family and their esteemed guests. They are mostly historical and theological in nature, although there are some purely fictional works and essays on practical subjects.
The library is enhanced by the presence of a dedicated scribe. This fellow spends all his time copying texts with exact accuracy, which are then sold or exchanged for other books.

The library has grown in musty size, presenting a impressive body of knowledge and risk of fire. A number of rare and valuable works have been obtained at great cost, protected by a small team of clerks and scribes.
Scholars now occasionally request access to the library, seeking to use your resources for their research. One can find a text on almost any subject, provided you can get directions!

The library is an impressive edifice of civilisation. There are more books than anyone could read in a lifetime, and there are rumours of a lost colony of scribes that inhabit the dark recesses at the back.

The courtyard and outbuildings are dominated by various workshops and warehouses. The castle is kept well-stocked with provisions, and the resident specialists keep the garrison's equipment in fine condition.

The courtyard and outbuildings are dominated by various workshops and warehouses. The castle is kept well-stocked with provisions, and the resident specialists keep the garrison's equipment in fine condition.

The courtyard and outbuildings are dominated by various workshops and warehouses. The castle is kept well-stocked with provisions, and the resident specialists keep the garrison's equipment in fine condition.

The courtyard and outbuildings are dominated by various workshops and warehouses. The castle is kept well-stocked with provisions, and the resident specialists keep the garrison's equipment in fine condition.
A twisted shrine to Chaos. The masses come to venerate the Dark Gods and recieve their blessings.
The keep gains a shrine to Sigmar, patron of humanity and the Empire. The appearance of an observant and pious liege is enough to inspire some minor moral improvements in the locals.

A small, dedicated temple of Sigmar is built for the castle inhabitants. The resident firebrand gives the troops a sense of fervour and martial glory, even if their training and equipment may be lacking.

The keep's shrine is expanded and improved. Some conservative figures say it is needlessly ostentatious and gaudy, the exact extravagance that a true Sigmarite would avoid. The majority agree that the gold filligree is a key part in understanding Sigmar's deeds.

The public temple is rebuilt to better serve the needs of the community. Children are educated in both literacy and proper morals by ancient texts, and itinerant flagellants plan marches to nearby lands.

The grandeur of the soul grows with the reverence of Sigmar, and the impressive structures built indicate that both spiritual and material worlds are well satisfied. A reliquary has been installed, attracting a regular stream of pilgrims and and wretches hoping for a miracle.

Wandering knights and pilgrims are lodged here, if only to prevent them from being a nuisance elsewhere. When battle is called, they eagerly join the greater host for a chance to gain glory and honour.
This settlement is not a particularly large one, but acts as a local point of entry for merchants.
This city is a regional trade hub.
This city is enriched by a constant stream of merchants and travellers from around the world.
This is a truely great city, sitting on one of the world's largest trade routes.
This is undoubtedly one of the greatest cities in the world, and recieves an unparalleled amount of traffic.
